column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=2. Related Work
#Text=Recently , encryption of personal information has been studied in depth as an effective way to solve the issues with SPI .
#Text=It has drawn the attention of experts and scholars in many fields , and has resulted in several strong methods .
#Text=In , Zhang et al. proposed a dual encryption reversible concealment algorithm for real-time network information based on chaotic sequences .
#Text=The two kinds of scrambling methods are used to double encrypt the network information .
#Text=For the first time , the chaotic sequence encryption algorithm is used to globally scramble the network information location .

#Text=The second time , based on another set of chaotic sequences , the 0 bit and 1 bit of the target pixel value are again scrambled to ensure that the selected explicit ( dense ) attack can be defended .
#Text=In this domain , the pseudo pixel is constructed by using the information to be embedded to replace the target pixel , thereby realizing rapid embedding of information .
#Text=The embedded information is directly extracted from the ciphertext information according to the key calculation .

#Text=After the receiver decrypts the information , each bit data of the target pixel is extracted to recover the original network information , thereby realizing reversible information hiding under double encryption .
#Text=The experimental results show that the algorithm has the advantages of fast and efficient information embedding and large capacity .

#Text=However , since the problem that some information can be shared is not considered , the algorithm has the problems of low security information recognition rate and high information query time delay .

#Text=In , Solomon et al. , aiming at the problem that the current algorithm ’s anti-deciphering ability is not high , proposed a network privacy protection digital information encryption technology based on homomorphic symbol frequency detection .
#Text=First , the digital information encryption key structure of the network privacy protection object is constructed .

#Text=Then , the encoding design of encryption and decryption is carried out , which uses the homomorphic symbol frequency detection to perform key optimization of digital encryption to improve the anti-deciphering level .
#Text=Finally , a simulation experiment was conducted .
#Text=The delay results show that the digital information encryption technology makes the encryption depth higher , and the deciphering rate of the encrypted data is effectively controlled .
#Text=However , there is a problem that the information query time is high .
#Text=Zhang et al. proposed an anti-peep network security authentication information encryption method .
#Text=The anti-peep network data attributes are selected according to the professional knowledge and the overall structure of the data , and the selection results are pre-processed .
#Text=According to the attribute processing result , a variable window is introduced to realize the determination and clearing of redundant data .
#Text=First , the method sets the minimum , maximum , and minimum thresholds of the variable window and initializes the window .
#Text=After that , the data to be matched is set , and the segmentation of the string is realized by the 3-gram method .
#Text=After calculating the similarity between the data to be matched and the window data record , the calculation result is stored in a two-dimensional array .

#Text=In addition , the data record similarity in the case of missing fields is calculated , thereby realizing the redundancy of each type of data in the network , and then the redundant data in the determination result is cleared .
#Text=The method treats the plaintext as a continuous bitstream transmitted in the privacy network and inputs its link number into the data encryption .
#Text=The seed is used to complete the initialization of the key sequence generator and generator , and the random encryption function is called to generate a random encryption number .
#Text=The encrypted bitstream is then encrypted using the encrypted number .
#Text=Experiments show that the information anti-attack coefficient is larger after encryption .
#Text=However , this method has a problem of low resource utilization and cannot effectively meet the needs of users .
#Text=Qian et al. proposed a scheme they refer to as Privacy-Preserving Selective Aggregation ( PPSA ) .
#Text=PPSA can be described as a method which encrypts users ’ SPI to prevent privacy disclosure from outside analysts and service providers alike .
#Text=PPSA fully supports selective aggregate functions that are used for online user-based behavior analysis while also being able to guarantee differential privacy .

#Text=The authors provided experimental results that show that their model can effectively support both aggregate queries ( overall and selective ) with acceptable levels of communication and computation overhead .
#Text=However , due to the fact that some information can be shared , the algorithm has the well-known issues of slow data acquisition speeds .

#Text=Zhang et al. proposed a user privacy protection method based on dynamic hiding of sensitive itemsets ( SIDH ) , which senses the positive and negative boundaries of sensitive rules corresponding to the itemsets space and incrementally expands the original snapshot to query anonymous set data .
#Text=This methodology hides and purifies sensitive association rules dynamically and finally realizes user privacy protection .
#Text=The experimental results showed that the SIDH method is hidden .
#Text=The speed of hiding sensitive itemsets is high , but the recognition rate of data is low .
